intro: Gymnosphaera denticulata, commonly known as the toothed cup moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green, leathery leaves with distinct, tooth-like serrations. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores when mature. Gymnosphaera denticulata plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
